params.fiatTicker: The currency we are trying to add in the registry.

params.test: Set to true to skip implementation initialization

getContractInstances().return: Collection of stable token contracts.Lengths of stable token contracts.

getVersionNumber().return: Storage version of the contract.Major version of the contract.Minor version of the contract.Patch version of the contract.

isOwner().details: Returns true if the caller is the current owner.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

params.fiatTicker: Type of currency to query corresponding contract.
The currency that is no longer supported.
params.index: The index in fiatTickers of fiatTicker.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner.     * NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

devdoc.title: contract that lists what stable coins are deployed as part of Celo's Stability protocol.

addNewStableToken(bytes,bytes).notice: Adds new Fiat Ticker and Stable Token contract to the registry.

methods.constructor: Sets initialized == true on implementation contracts

getContractInstances().notice: Returns all the contract instances created.

getVersionNumber().notice: Returns the storage, major, minor, and patch version of the contract.

initialize(bytes,bytes).notice: Used in place of the constructor to allow the contract to be upgradable via proxy.

queryStableTokenContractNames(bytes).notice: Queries a corresponding StableToken contract name based on fiat ticker.
